interestingcomments.content: Thanks, sounds like a neat trick. I've been recording separately but never thought to use it as a bridge. Do you lay down the audio in editing stage first? Or drop in after your cuts? Audio has to come first, if I have been creating an archive of a production.
interestingcomments.MarkedSent: thanks, sounds like a neat trick. i've been recording separately but never thought to use it as a bridge. do you lay down the audio in editing stage first? or drop in after your cuts? audio has to come first, if i have been creating an -----> archive !!!  of a production.

interestingcomments.content: Audio has to come first, if I have been creating an archive of a production. Audio always comes first, it's a backbone of a timeline. Unless, of course, it is some stock footage that is required to have no sound.
